title: PC 7, Miami (Ohio) 3: Friars win season-opener behind Mingoia, Jankowski
text: PC 7, Miami (Ohio) 3: Friars win season-opener behind Mingoia, Jankowski Comment By Special to the Journal providencejournal.com By Special to the Journal Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 10:01 PM By Special to the Journal Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 10:01 PM Providence College scored three goals in a span of 4:22 late in the first period to take control of the game and the defending national champions went on to beat Miami University, 7-3, in the Friars' season-opener on Friday night in Oxford, Ohio. Trevor Mingoia recorded his third two-goal game of his career while Mark Jankowski had a career-high four points (one goal, three assists). Miami jumped out to a 1-0 lead on Jack Roslovic's goal 5:14 into the game. But Robbie Hennessey's first career goal at 12:40 of the first period tied it. Bryan Lemos and Steven Ruggiero had the assists for their first career points. Just under three minutes later, Mingoia was awarded a penalty shot and the senior cashed in, beating Miami goalie Jay Williams for a 2-1 lead. The Friars increased their lead to, 3-1, 1:42 later when Anthony Florentino scored off assists from Jake Walman and Jankowski. Miami made it a one-goal game 1:35 into the second period on a Colin Sullivan tally but PC extended the lead back to two six minutes later on a Brandon Tanev goal. Jankowski and Mingoia were credited with the assists. Mingoia's second goal of the game, off Jankowski's third helper, made it 5-2 late in the second period. Jankowski joined the goal scoring spree early in the third when he stuffed a loose puck past Williams for a 6-2 advantage. Providence closed out its scoring when Brian Pinho tipped in a Tom Parisi shot at 11:36 of the third. The Friars and Red Hawks play again on Saturday at 7:05 p.m. By Special to the Journal providencejournal.com By Special to the Journal Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 10:01 PM
